authorization.getWhoami.description: Returns user data of the current authenticated user

authorization.revoke.description: Revoke the access token of the current authenticated user

backend.account.changePassword.description: Changes the password of the authenticated user

backend.account.get.description: Returns user data of the authenticated user

backend.account.update.description: Updates user data of the authenticated user

backend.action.execute.description: Executes a specific action. This method should be used to test an action configuration

backend.action.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of actions

backend.action.getCommits.description: Returns a paginated list of action commits

backend.agent.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of agents

backend.agent.getTools.description: Returns available tools for an agent

backend.agent.message.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of agent messages

backend.app.deleteToken.description: Deletes an existing token from an app

backend.app.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of apps

backend.audit.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of audits

backend.backup.export.description: Generates an backup of the current system

backend.backup.import.description: Imports an backup to the current system

backend.bundle.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of bundles

backend.bundle.publish.description: Publish an existing bundle to the marketplace

backend.category.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of categories

backend.config.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of configuration values

backend.connection.agent.send.description: Sends a message to an agent

backend.connection.database.createRow.description: Creates a new row at a table on a database

backend.connection.database.createTable.description: Creates a new table on a database

backend.connection.database.deleteRow.description: Deletes an existing row at a table on a database

backend.connection.database.deleteTable.description: Deletes an existing table on a database

backend.connection.database.getRow.description: Returns a specific row at a table on a database

backend.connection.database.getRows.description: Returns paginated rows at a table on a database

backend.connection.database.getTable.description: Returns the schema of a specific table on a database

backend.connection.database.getTables.description: Returns all available tables on a database

backend.connection.database.updateRow.description: Updates an existing row at a table on a database

backend.connection.database.updateTable.description: Updates an existing table on a database

backend.connection.filesystem.create.description: Uploads one or more files on the filesystem connection

backend.connection.filesystem.delete.description: Deletes an existing file on the filesystem connection

backend.connection.filesystem.get.description: Returns the content of the provided file id on the filesystem connection

backend.connection.filesystem.getAll.description: Returns all available files on the filesystem connection

backend.connection.filesystem.update.description: Updates an existing file on the filesystem connection

backend.connection.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of connections

backend.connection.getRedirect.description: Returns a redirect url to start the OAuth2 authorization flow for the given connection

backend.connection.http.execute.description: Sends an arbitrary HTTP request to the connection

backend.cronjob.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of cronjobs

backend.event.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of events

backend.firewall.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of firewall rules

backend.form.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of forms

backend.generator.executeProvider.description: Executes a generator with the provided config

backend.generator.getChangelog.description: Generates a changelog of all potential changes if you execute this generator with the provided config

backend.identity.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of identities

backend.log.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of logs

backend.log.getAllErrors.description: Returns a paginated list of log errors

backend.marketplace.action.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of marketplace actions

backend.marketplace.action.install.description: Installs an action from the marketplace

backend.marketplace.action.upgrade.description: Upgrades an action from the marketplace

backend.marketplace.app.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of marketplace apps

backend.marketplace.app.install.description: Installs an app from the marketplace

backend.marketplace.app.upgrade.description: Upgrades an app from the marketplace

backend.marketplace.bundle.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of marketplace bundles

backend.marketplace.bundle.install.description: Installs an bundle from the marketplace

backend.marketplace.bundle.upgrade.description: Upgrades an bundle from the marketplace

backend.operation.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of operations

backend.page.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of pages

backend.plan.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of plans

backend.rate.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of rate limitations

backend.role.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of roles

backend.schema.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of schemas

backend.schema.getCommits.description: Returns a paginated list of schema commits

backend.schema.getPreview.description: Returns a HTML preview of the provided schema

backend.scope.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of scopes

backend.scope.getCategories.description: Returns all available scopes grouped by category

backend.sdk.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of SDKs

backend.statistic.getActivitiesPerUser.description: Returns a statistic containing the activities per user

backend.statistic.getCountRequests.description: Returns a statistic containing the request count

backend.statistic.getErrorsPerOperation.description: Returns a statistic containing the errors per operation

backend.statistic.getIncomingRequests.description: Returns a statistic containing the incoming requests

backend.statistic.getIncomingTransaction.description: Returns a statistic containing the incoming transactions

backend.statistic.getIssuedTokens.description: Returns a statistic containing the issues tokens

backend.statistic.getMostUsedActivities.description: Returns a statistic containing the most used activities

backend.statistic.getMostUsedApps.description: Returns a statistic containing the most used apps

backend.statistic.getMostUsedOperations.description: Returns a statistic containing the most used operations

backend.statistic.getRequestsPerIP.description: Returns a statistic containing the requests per ip

backend.statistic.getRequestsPerOperatio.description: Returns a statistic containing the requests per operation

backend.statistic.getRequestsPerUser.description: Returns a statistic containing the requests per user

backend.statistic.getTestCoverage.description: Returns a statistic containing the test coverage

backend.statistic.getTimeAverage.description: Returns a statistic containing the time average

backend.statistic.getTimePerOperation.description: Returns a statistic containing the time per operation

backend.statistic.getUsedPoints.description: Returns a statistic containing the used points

backend.statistic.getUserRegistrations.description: Returns a statistic containing the user registrations

backend.taxonomy.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of taxonomies

backend.taxonomy.move.description: Moves the provided ids to the taxonomy

backend.test.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of tests

backend.token.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of tokens

backend.transaction.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of transactions

backend.trash.getAllByType.description: Returns all deleted records by trash type

backend.trigger.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of triggers

backend.user.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of users

backend.user.resend.description: Resend the activation mail to the provided user

backend.webhook.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of webhooks

consumer.account.activate.description: Activates an previously registered account through a token which was provided to the user via email

consumer.account.authorize.description: Authorizes the access of a specific app for the authenticated user

consumer.account.changePassword.description: Change the password for the authenticated user

consumer.account.executePasswordReset.description: Change the password after the password reset flow was started

consumer.account.get.description: Returns a user data for the authenticated user

consumer.account.getApp.description: Returns information about a specific app to start the OAuth2 authorization code flow

consumer.account.login.description: User login by providing a username and password

consumer.account.refresh.description: Refresh a previously obtained access token

consumer.account.update.description: Updates user data for the authenticated user

consumer.app.create.description: Creates a new app for the authenticated user

consumer.app.delete.description: Deletes an existing app for the authenticated user

consumer.app.get.description: Returns a specific app for the authenticated user

consumer.app.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of apps which are assigned to the authenticated user

consumer.app.update.description: Updates an existing app for the authenticated user

consumer.event.get.description: Returns a specific event for the authenticated user

consumer.event.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of apps which are assigned to the authenticated user

consumer.form.get.description: Returns a specific form for the authenticated user

consumer.form.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of forms which are relevant to the authenticated user

consumer.grant.delete.description: Deletes an existing grant for an app which was created by the authenticated user

consumer.grant.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of grants which are assigned to the authenticated user

consumer.identity.exchange.description: Identity callback endpoint to exchange an access token

consumer.identity.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of identities which are relevant to the authenticated user

consumer.identity.redirect.description: Redirect the user to the configured identity provider

consumer.log.get.description: Returns a specific log for the authenticated user

consumer.log.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of logs which are assigned to the authenticated user

consumer.page.get.description: Returns a specific page for the authenticated user

consumer.page.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of pages which are relevant to the authenticated user

consumer.payment.checkout.description: Start the checkout process for a specific plan

consumer.payment.portal.description: Generates a payment portal link for the authenticated user

consumer.plan.get.description: Returns a specific plan for the authenticated user

consumer.plan.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of plans which are relevant to the authenticated user

consumer.scope.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of scopes which are assigned to the authenticated user

consumer.token.create.description: Creates a new token for the authenticated user

consumer.token.delete.description: Deletes an existing token for the authenticated user

consumer.token.get.description: Returns a specific token for the authenticated user

consumer.token.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of tokens which are assigned to the authenticated user

consumer.token.update.description: Updates an existing token for the authenticated user

consumer.transaction.get.description: Returns a specific transaction for the authenticated user

consumer.transaction.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of transactions which are assigned to the authenticated user

consumer.webhook.create.description: Creates a new webhook for the authenticated user

consumer.webhook.delete.description: Deletes an existing webhook for the authenticated user

consumer.webhook.get.description: Returns a specific webhook for the authenticated user

consumer.webhook.getAll.description: Returns a paginated list of webhooks which are assigned to the authenticated user

consumer.webhook.update.description: Updates an existing webhook for the authenticated user

system.connection.callback.description: Connection OAuth2 callback to authorize a connection

system.meta.getAbout.description: Returns meta information and links about the current installed Fusio version

system.meta.getDebug.description: Debug endpoint which returns the provided data

system.meta.getHealth.description: Health check endpoint which returns information about the health status of the system

system.meta.getSchema.description: Returns details of a specific schema

system.payment.webhook.description: Payment webhook endpoint after successful purchase of a plan

verifyPassword.description: To verify the new password must contain the same value as the new password

Backend_Action.description: This object represents the business logic which can be executed either through an operation or cronjob

status.description: Status of the object either 1 = active or 0 = deleted

class.description: Underlying class of this action which handles the action logic

async.description: Whether to execute the action asynchronously, if true the action directly returns a 202 response and the action is executed later on in the background, useful for expensive operations

config.description: Contains the action specific configuration. The config depends on the action class, you can get all details of the config format by passing the class to the backend-action-getForm tool

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

Backend_ActionCollection.description: A paginated collection of action objects

Backend_ActionCommit.description: An action commit which represents a change in the action configuration

user.description: The user which has made the change

commitHash.description: A unique hash which represents this commit

Backend_ActionCommitCollection.description: A paginated collection of action commit objects

Backend_ActionConfig.description: The action configuration which contains arbitrary key-value entries

Backend_ActionExecuteRequest.description: Represents a request to execute an action

headers.description: The response header returned by the action

body.description: The response body returned by the action

Backend_ActionIndex.description: Contains all possible classes which can be used at an action as class

name.description: Human-readable name of the action class

class.description: Technical identifier of the action class

connection.description: The agent connection which should be used

outgoing.description: Describes the outgoing response payload, this must contain a schema name

action.description: Action which gets invoked for each generated response

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

Backend_AgentCollection.description: Represents a collection of agent messages

mime.description: The mime of the binary data

Backend_AgentContentToolCallFunction.description: Concrete values for a function tool call

Backend_AgentMessage.description: This object represents an agent message

role.description: The role of this message i.e. user, assistant or system

Backend_AgentMessageCollection.description: Represents a collection of agent messages

Backend_AgentTools.description: Represents a collection of available tools

Backend_App.description: This object represents an app to access the API on-behalf of a user

status.description: Status of the object either 1 = active, 2 = pending, 3 = deactivated or 4 = deleted

url.description: Url where the app is hosted

parameters.description: Optional URL-encoded parameters of the app i.e. foo=bar&bar=foo

appKey.description: The app key also known as client id which is generated on creation

appSecret.description: The app secret also known as client secret which is generated on creation

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

date.description: The create date of this object

scopes.description: A list of assigned scopes for this app

tokens.description: A list of tokens which are assigned to this app

Backend_AppCollection.description: A paginated collection of app objects

Backend_Audit.description: This object represents an audit which is created every time something was changed at the system

ip.description: IP which as issued the request

date.description: Insert date of this audit event

Backend_AuditCollection.description: A paginated collection of audit objects

Backend_AuditObject.description: A key value object containing the changes

Backend_BackupExport.description: Export of the complete system configuration

Backend_BackupImport.description: Import a previously exported system configuration

Backend_BackupImportResult.description: Result of a backup import operation

Backend_Bundle.description: This object represents a bundle which contains action, schema, event, cronjob and trigger configurations from you local instance

summary.description: Short summary which explains the use case for this bundle

description.description: Long description how to use this bundle may also contains markdown syntax

cost.description: Optional a cost for this bundle

Backend_BundleCollection.description: A paginated collection of bundle objects

Backend_Category.description: This object represents a category. Every user is assigned to a category and can only view objects which are also assigned to the same category, through this it is possible to build separate areas for external developers

Backend_CategoryCollection.description: A paginated collection of category objects

Backend_Config.description: This object represents a system configuration

description.description: A short description fo this configuration value

Backend_ConfigCollection.description: A paginated collection of config objects

Backend_Connection.description: This object represents a connection to an external system like i.e. a database, message-queue or client-sdk

class.description: Underlying class of this connection which returns a configured client connection i.e. database, message-queue or client-sdk

oauth2.description: Indicates whether it is possible to start an OAuth2 authorization code flow on this connection

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

Backend_ConnectionCollection.description: A paginated collection of connection objects

Backend_ConnectionConfig.description: The connection configuration which contains arbitrary key-value entries

Backend_ConnectionIndex.description: Contains all possible classes which can be used at an connection as class

name.description: Human-readable name of the connection class

class.description: Technical identifier of the connection class

Backend_ConnectionRedirectResponse.description: Redirect response to initiate an OAuth2 flow

Backend_Cronjob.description: This object represents a cronjob which can invoke an action at a specific interval

cron.description: The cron expression i.e. */5 * * * * for every 5 minutes

action.description: The target action which gets invoked

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

errors.description: Contains an array of errors in case the cronjob has failed

Backend_CronjobCollection.description: A paginated collection of cronjob objects

Backend_CronjobError.description: Represents an error which occurred on cronjob execution

Backend_Dashboard.description: Represents an object containing all widget data for the dashboard

Backend_DatabaseRow.description: This object represents a row on a relational table

Backend_DatabaseRowCollection.description: A paginated collection of database rows

Backend_DatabaseTable.description: This object represents a relational table on a database connection

Backend_DatabaseTableColumn.description: This object represents a column at a relation table

type.description: The column type i.e. integer or string

length.description: Optional the max length of the column

precision.description: Optional the precision of the column

scale.description: Optional the scale of the column

unsigned.description: Indicates whether the column is unsigned, relevant for integer types

fixed.description: Indicates whether the column has a fixed length

notNull.description: Indicates whether the column allows null

autoIncrement.description: Indicates whether this column is an auto increment column

comment.description: Optional a comment for this column

Backend_DatabaseTableForeignKeyConstrain.description: This object represents a foreign key constraint on a relational database

name.description: Name of the foreign key constraint

Backend_DatabaseTableIndex.description: This object represents a table index on a relational database

unique.description: Indicates whether the index is unique

Backend_Event.description: This object represents an event which can be triggered by an action

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

Backend_EventCollection.description: A paginated collection of event objects

Backend_File.description: This object represents a file on the filesystem

lastModified.description: Last modified date of the file

Backend_FileCollection.description: A paginated collection of file objects

Backend_Firewall.description: This object represents a firewall rule which blocks specific IP addresses

type.description: The type of the rule either 1 = allow or 0 = deny

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

Backend_FirewallCollection.description: A paginated collection of firewall objects

Backend_Form.description: This object represents a form which helps to dynamically generate a form at a frontend app

status.description: Status of the object either 1 = active or 0 = deleted

operationId.description: Target operation which gets invoked through this form

uiSchema.description: Optional an UI schema to dynamically describe this form

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

Backend_FormCollection.description: A paginated collection of form objects

name.description: Human-readable name of the generator class

class.description: Technical identifier of the generator class

Backend_GeneratorIndexProviders.description: Contains all possible classes which can be used at an generator as class

Backend_HttpRequest.description: This object represents a HTTP request

Backend_HttpResponse.description: This object represents a HTTP response

Backend_Identity.description: This object represents an identity which allows to authenticate with a remote identity provider

appId.description: The target app for this identity

roleId.description: Role which is assigned to new users

icon.description: An icon for this identity provider

class.description: Underlying class of this identity provider

Backend_IdentityCollection.description: A paginated collection of identity objects

Backend_IdentityIndex.description: Contains all possible classes which can be used at an identity as class

name.description: Human-readable name of the identity class

class.description: Technical identifier of the identity class

Backend_Log.description: This object represents a log entry. Every HTTP requests to the system generates such a log entry.

ip.description: The remote IP which has initiated the request

userAgent.description: The user agent provided by the HTTP user agent header

method.description: The HTTP method i.e. GET or POST

errors.description: An array of errors which occurred through this request

Backend_LogCollection.description: A paginated collection of log objects

Backend_LogErrorCollection.description: A paginated collection of log error objects

Backend_Operation.description: This object represents an operation, an operation invokes an action in case a specific HTTP method and path was requested. It defines also schema information about the request and response payload

status.description: Status of the object either 1 = active or 0 = deleted

active.description: Indicates whether the operation is active

public.description: Indicates whether the operation is public, if false a user must provide an Authorization header with an Bearer access token

stability.description: Describes the stability of this operation 0 = deprecated, 1 = experimental, 2 = stable and 3 = legacy

description.description: A short description of this operation, it should explain the operation in a simple and precise way

httpMethod.description: The target HTTP method i.e. GET or POST

httpPath.description: The target HTTP path i.e. /foo or /product/:product_id

httpCode.description: The success HTTP code i.e. 200 or 201

name.description: Unique name of the object. It is recommended to group your operations into logical units by using a dot i.e. product.getAll and product.insert which has also an effect on the automatically generated SDK

incoming.description: Describes the incoming request payload, this must contain a schema name

outgoing.description: Describes the outgoing response payload, this must contain a schema name

throws.description: Describes error responses for i.e. client or server errors

action.description: The target action to invoke, this must contain an action name

costs.description: Costs to invoke this operation. A user can only invoke this operation in case he has enough points

scopes.description: Scopes which are required to invoke this operation

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

Backend_OperationCollection.description: A paginated collection of operation objects

Backend_Page.description: This object represents a page at the developer portal

status.description: Status of the object either 1 = visible, 2 = invisible or 0 = deleted

slug.description: Slug of the page which gets dynamically generated from the title

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

Backend_PageCollection.description: A paginated collection of page objects

Backend_Plan.description: This object represents a plan, a plan allows users to obtain points or in general subscribe to your app

points.description: The points which are assigned to the user on purchase

period.description: Whether the plan is one-time or periodically

externalId.description: An external id of a remote payment provider like Stripe

scopes.description: Scopes which are assigned dynamically to the user on purchase

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

Backend_PlanCollection.description: A paginated collection of plan objects

Backend_Rate.description: This object represents a rate limitation, which allows to limit the requests which a user can send

priority.description: All rates are applied based on the priority, higher priorities are applied first

allocation.description: Through a rate allocation a user gets assigned to a specific rate

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

Backend_RateAllocation.description: This object represents a rate allocation, in case a request matches it gets assigned to the attached rate

Backend_RateCollection.description: A paginated collection of rate objects

Backend_Role.description: This object represents a role, every user is assigned to a role and all scopes of the role are automatically attached to the user

categoryId.description: The assigned category id of this role

scopes.description: All scopes which are assigned to this role

Backend_RoleCollection.description: A paginated collection of role objects

Backend_Schema.description: This object represents a schema to describe a JSON payload

status.description: Status of the object either 1 = active or 0 = deleted

source.description: The TypeSchema specification to describe a JSON payload

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

Backend_SchemaCollection.description: A paginated collection of schema objects

Backend_SchemaCommit.description: A schema commit which represents a change in the schema source

user.description: The user which has made the change

commitHash.description: A unique hash which represents this commit

Backend_SchemaCommitCollection.description: A paginated collection of schema commit objects

Backend_SchemaForm.description: Contains a UI vocabulary to describe the UI of the schema

Backend_Scope.description: This object represents a scope. A scope is assigned to a user and is required to access operations

operations.description: All operations which can be access through this scope

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

Backend_ScopeCollection.description: A paginated collection of scope objects

Backend_SdkTypes.description: Represents available SDK type which can be generated

Backend_Taxonomy.description: This object represents a taxonomy. A taxonomy helps to internally organize operations, actions and other entities

Backend_TaxonomyCollection.description: A paginated collection of taxonomy objects

Backend_TaxonomyMove.description: Moves the provided objects to a taxonomy

Backend_Test.description: This object represents a test. A test helps to verify that all operations work as expected

status.description: Status of the object either 1 = pending, 2 = success, 3 = warning, 4 = error, 5 = skipped or 6 = disabled

Backend_TestCollection.description: A paginated collection of test objects

Backend_Token.description: This object represents a token, this an access token which was requested by a user

status.description: Status of the object either 1 = active or 2 = deleted

Backend_TokenCollection.description: A paginated collection of token objects

Backend_Transaction.description: This object represents a transaction. The system generates a transaction in case a payment was successfully executed

Backend_TransactionCollection.description: A paginated collection of transaction objects

status.description: Status of the object either 1 = active or 0 = deleted

Backend_TrashDataCollection.description: A paginated collection of deleted objects

Backend_Trigger.description: This object represents a trigger which can invoke an action on a custom event

event.description: The name of the trigger event

action.description: The target action which gets invoked

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

Backend_TriggerCollection.description: A paginated collection of trigger objects

roleId.description: A role which is assigned to the user

planId.description: A plan which is assigned to the user

status.description: Status of the object either 1 = active, 2 = disabled or 0 = deleted

email.description: The email address of the user

scopes.description: List of scopes which are assigned to the user

metadata.description: Use this parameter to attach key-value data

Backend_UserCollection.description: A paginated collection of user objects

Backend_Webhook.description: This object represents a webhook, a webhook is called in case a specific event was triggered

Backend_WebhookCollection.description: A paginated collection of webhook objects

Common_FormContainer.description: Represents a config form with a list of elements

Common_FormElementInput.description: Form element which represents an input element

type.description: The input type i.e. text or password, all HTML input types are allowed

Common_FormElementSelect.description: Form element which represents a select element

options.description: Available options for the select element

Common_FormElementTag.description: Form element which represents an input tag editor to enter comma-separated values

Common_FormElementTextArea.description: Form element which represents a textarea

mode.description: Describes which data is provided at the textarea, this can be i.e. a programming language like php, java or python or also a data format like json

MarketplaceInstall.description: Installs an object from the marketplace

MarketplaceObject.description: Base class of all objects on the marketplace
